publicwhip.spmotion: *S2M-5241 Lord James Douglas-Hamilton: Launch of the White Ribbon Campaign—That the Parliament supports the setting-up of the White Ribbon Scotland Campaign; commends Amnesty International and the Men’s Health Forum Scotland for launching this campaign; urges men in Scotland to get involved in campaigning to end violence against women; sees violence against women as a human rights abuse and an issue for all of society to tackle, and believes that the terms of discourse need to be changed so that violence against women is no longer seen as a "women’s issue" but as an issue for all society.

S2M-5241 Launch of the White Ribbon Campaign (lodged on 28 November 2006) Christine Grahame*, Mr Kenny MacAskill*, Robin Harper*, Mr Jamie Stone*, Murray Tosh*, Bruce Crawford*, Alex Fergusson*, Bill Butler*, Richard Lochhead*, Rob Gibson*, Eleanor Scott*, Trish Godman*, Christine May*, Stewart Stevenson*, Mrs Nanette Milne*, Ms Sandra White*, Patrick Harvie*, Nora Radcliffe*, Mr David Davidson*, Dave Petrie*, Chris Ballance*, Mr Jamie McGrigor*, John Swinburne*, Tricia Marwick*, Margaret Mitchell*, Mr Jim Wallace*, Ms Maureen Watt*, Mr Kenneth Macintosh*, Roseanna Cunningham*, Ms Rosemary Byrne*

S2M-5241 Lord James Douglas-Hamilton: Launch of the White Ribbon Campaign—That the Parliament supports the setting-up of the White Ribbon Scotland Campaign; commends Amnesty International and the Men’s Health Forum Scotland for launching this campaign; urges men in Scotland to get involved in campaigning to end violence against women; sees violence against women as a human rights abuse and an issue for all of society to tackle, and believes that the terms of discourse need to be changed so that violence against women is no longer seen as a "women’s issue" but as an issue for all society. Supported by: Christine Grahame, Mr Kenny MacAskill, Robin Harper, Mr Jamie Stone, Murray Tosh, Bruce Crawford, Alex Fergusson, Bill Butler, Richard Lochhead, Rob Gibson, Eleanor Scott, Trish Godman, Christine May, Stewart Stevenson, Mrs Nanette Milne, Ms Sandra White, Patrick Harvie, Nora Radcliffe, Mr David Davidson, Dave Petrie, Chris Ballance, Mr Jamie McGrigor, John Swinburne, Tricia Marwick, Margaret Mitchell, Mr Jim Wallace, Ms Maureen Watt, Mr Kenneth Macintosh, Roseanna Cunningham, Ms Rosemary Byrne, Margaret Smith*, John Scott*, Colin Fox*
S2M-5241 Launch of the White Ribbon Campaign (lodged on 28 November 2006) Dr Elaine Murray*, Shiona Baird*, Tommy Sheridan*, Mr Adam Ingram*

S2M-5241 Launch of the White Ribbon Campaign (lodged on 28 November 2006) Iain Smith* Contents An A B C D E F G H I J
S2M-5241 Launch of the White Ribbon Campaign (lodged on 28 November 2006) Dennis Canavan* Contents An A B C D E F G H I J

S2M-5241 Lord James Douglas-Hamilton: Launch of the White Ribbon Campaign—That the Parliament supports the setting-up of the White Ribbon Scotland Campaign; commends Amnesty International and the Men’s Health Forum Scotland for launching this campaign; urges men in Scotland to get involved in campaigning to end violence against women; sees violence against women as a human rights abuse and an issue for all of society to tackle, and believes that the terms of discourse need to be changed so that violence against women is no longer seen as a "women’s issue" but as an issue for all society. Supported by: Christine Grahame, Mr Kenny MacAskill, Robin Harper, Mr Jamie Stone, Murray Tosh, Bruce Crawford, Alex Fergusson, Bill Butler, Richard Lochhead, Rob Gibson, Eleanor Scott, Trish Godman, Christine May, Stewart Stevenson, Mrs Nanette Milne, Ms Sandra White, Patrick Harvie, Nora Radcliffe, Mr David Davidson, Dave Petrie, Chris Ballance, Mr Jamie McGrigor, John Swinburne, Tricia Marwick, Margaret Mitchell, Mr Jim Wallace, Ms Maureen Watt, Mr Kenneth Macintosh, Roseanna Cunningham, Ms Rosemary Byrne, Margaret Smith, John Scott, Colin Fox, Dr Elaine Murray, Shiona Baird, Tommy Sheridan, Mr Adam Ingram, Donald Gorrie, Michael McMahon, Frances Curran, Linda Fabiani, Iain Smith, Dennis Canavan, Mr John Swinney, Mr Ted Brocklebank, Mr Stewart Maxwell, Mr Charlie Gordon
